RECORD.TEXT: 173906547 PUOMC 4047430 099712 943713 5/14/1999 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Unsigned DIS Report Status : Unsigned DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : GURNEPASCCAUGH , NIA L UNIT NUMBER : 990-30-76 ADMISSION DATE : 05/14/1999 DISCHARGE DATE : 05/23/1999 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Coronary artery disease . ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSIS : 1. Unstable angina pectoris . 2. Congestive heart failure . 3. Chronic renal failure , hemodialysis dependent . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : 5/18/99 Coronary artery bypass graft using the left internal mammary artery to the left anterior descending , saphenous vein graft to the posterior descending artery and posterior left ventricular artery and the saphenous vein graft to the diagonal artery . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 64-year-old woman with accelerating angina pectoris , who had a cardiac catheterization at Chimass Community Hospital revealing three-vessel disease . The patient was transferred to Ph University Of Medical Center for a cardiac surgical evaluation . The patient 's cardiac history has been known for several years . In 05/96 , the patient had a cardiac catheterization that revealed a moderate right coronary artery ostial lesion , severe lesion at the ostial PLV , 50-60% circumflex lesion , 40% proximal left anterior descending , and severe proximal D1 . The patient was admitted to the Bitamp Memorial on 5/11/99 , having had three episodes of chest pain . Her CKs were found to be elevated with a peak of 1237 with only one increase in MB fractionation . She had a repeat cardiac catheterization at Chimass Community Hospital on 5/13/99 , which showed three-vessel disease , including right coronary artery 70% ostial , left anterior descending 70% , circumflex 100% . Her ejection fraction was estimated at 60% . There was 1 mitral regurgitation . The patient was transferred to the Ph University Of Medical Center . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was brought to the operating room on 5/18/99 , where a coronary artery bypass graft x 4 was performed . The bypasses are listed above . The bypass time was 2 hours , 19 minutes , cross-clamp time was 1 hour , 36 minutes . The patient received 3 units of packed red blood cells . She received 1 unit of normal saline . Postoperatively , the patient was taken to the Surgical Intensive Care Unit . The patient arrived at the Surgical Intensive Care Unit on dopamine at 150 , epinephrine at .25 , levofloxacin at 7 , Xylocaine at 1.5 , Nitroglycerin at 150 , Fentanyl / Versed drip at 8 . Her sedation was weaned and she was extubated as per protocol . Her chest tubes were removed , as per protocol . The patient was weaned off her pressors and was transferred from the Surgical Intensive Care Unit to the Goman 12 Mini-Unit on postoperative day 1 . 1. Cardiovascular : The patient 's postoperative course was routine . Prior to her transfer to the Goman 12 Unit , her last cardiac index in the Surgical Intensive Care Unit had been between 2.0 and 2.2 . 2. Renal : The patient was dialyzed , as stated above , and had fluid taken off in order to approach her preoperative weight . At the time of discharge , the patient 's weight was approximately 173 pounds with a preoperative weight of 156 pounds . Her hematocrit was 26.9 . Her potassium was 4.3 . Her creatinine was 4.2. 3 . Endocrine : The patient was followed by the Diabetes / Endocrine Service . Her NPH and regular insulin doses were adjusted accordingly . Her regular insulin consisted of insulin sliding scale . 4. Infectious Disease : The patient was thought to have had rigors during one of her dialysis sessions . As such , the patient was given Vancomycin and Gentamicin for levels . However , it should be stated that all of her cultures while at Ph University Of Medical Center were negative for growth . As such , antibiotics should not be continued . It should be pointed out , however , that a urinalysis from 5/14/99 showed positive white blood cells . However , this was in the setting of the patient , who more than likely has colonization of her bladder secondary to decreased to no urine output . At the time of discharge , the patient was in satisfactory condition , tolerating good PO intake on her renal diet . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : NPH insulin 25 units subq q AM . NPH insulin 8 units subq q PM before dinner . Aspirin 81 mg. PO QD . Iron 325 mg. PO QD . Phoslo 6 mg. PO TID . Epogen 4000 units IV on Tuesdays and Wednesdays . Tylenol 650 mg. PO q 6 h PRN pain . At the time of discharge , the patient was planned to go to rehabilitation . Discharge follow up will be with Dr. Burgeshuff 's service ( 438-9748 ) . The office will call the patient in approximately three to four weeks to see him . The patient should also follow up with Dr. Cord of Cardiology . The patient should also follow up with Dr. Lishdail , her Renal Specialist . OTESA KOTEVI , M.D. TR : rc DD : 05/22/1999 TD : 05/22/1999 10:06 A cc : [ report_end ]
